info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 13 at 11:29AM PDT until April 14 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT ABOVE 3500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Snow above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting 30 to 40 mph through mountain passes and across exposed ridges will result in areas of reduced visibility due to blowing snow. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades including including Highways 58, 62, 230, and 138. This also includes Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Crescent Lake, the resort at Willamette Pass, and areas near Union Creek. * WHEN...Until midnight PDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
